header.title: 'Ageist BBC' Question Time viewers LIVID after Dimbleby declares 'snowflake only' audience
header.subtitle: BBC Question Time viewers have been left outraged after the show announced that when in Leeds in two weeks time only those under the age of 30 will be allowed to appear in the audience.
header.postText: 'The announcement was made at the end of last night’s show when host David Dimbleby read out the programme’s schedule for the next two weeks.', 'As well as highlighting that only younger voters would be allowed to appear in the audience in two weeks time, Mr Dimbleby also revealed that Labour’s Brexit spokesman would make an appearance next week.', 'The BBC host said: Next Thursday we’re going to be in Dover, we have the Shadow Secretary of State from Exiting the EU, Kier Starmer, we have the Irish MEP Mariad McGuiness, and the actor Brian Cox.', 'The week after that we’re in Leeds where our audience is all going to be under 30.', 'BBC', 'Mr Dimbleby’s declaration left some viewers furious that a large demographic of the UK population would be ignored for the week.', 'One angry member of the public, Mark McGrane, said: Well, I was just about to apply to come to Leeds then you added under 30 ageism.', 'The BBC is being ageist!', 'Meanwhile, another suggested the questions from the audience in Leeds would dum down the debate.', 'Nick Griffin attacks Jack Straw’s father - My father was in the RAF during the second World war while Mr Straw’s father was in prison for refusing to fight Adolf Hitler.', 'They said: An under 30 audience?', 'Oh great, questions like what is your favourite Pokemon? then.', 'Twitter user Jolyon Latham added: “Need a Sky+ option to make it skip the Leeds BBC Question Time.', '“An audience of self-entitled, work-shy under 30-year-old snowflakes.', '“Marvellous.”', 'However, some argued that the idea would help give new energy to the programme.', 'One person wrote: I’d love to see a BBC Question Time panel and audience made up purely of people under 30.', 'A fresh perspective instead of the same old, tired people week-in, week out.', 'Talk to the future of our country, see what they have to say.', 'A second user said:Cannot wait for Leeds under 30 's.', 'Love the city of my Birth, an amazing vibrant place with unbelievably energetic and terribly intelligent young people. ', 'Polls have found that younger voters are more likely to have voted to remain in the EU referendum and are more likely to support Labour.', 'Report by Ipsos Mori from September last year found that UK citizens between the ages of 18 and 30 are still angry and emotional about the results of the referendum.'
header.socioLingVar: Age - Over 65s,Nationality - European or anti-Europeans,Age - General,Physical Identity - Physical (and Mental) Impairments, Ideological and Political Identity - General,Ethnicity - General,Gender - General
